AcceptedExecutionResponse.description: This response contains the identifiers for an execution that was recently accepted by the system. These identifiers can be used to query the execution status later.
AcceptedExecutionResponse.title: AcceptedExecutionResponse

AgentCheckError.description: Indicates that some facts could not be gathered on a specific agent due to issues such as gathering failure or timeout. This error provides context for troubleshooting agent data collection problems.

agent_id.description: The unique identifier of the agent involved in the error.

facts.description: Facts gathered from the target agent, which may include errors encountered during the data collection process.

message.description: A detailed message describing the error encountered during fact gathering on the agent.

type.description: The type of error encountered during fact gathering on the agent.

AgentCheckError.title: AgentCheckError

AgentCheckResult.description: Represents the result of a check performed on a specific agent, including gathered facts and expectation evaluations.

agent_id.description: The unique identifier of the agent for which the check was performed.

expectation_evaluations.description: Result of the single expectation evaluation, indicating whether the expectation was met for the agent's check.

facts.description: Facts gathered from the target agent during the check execution.

values.description: Values resolved for the current execution, representing the computed results for the agent's check.

AgentCheckResult.title: AgentCheckResult

AgentReport.description: Represents an individual agent report of an operation, including agent identification, result, state differences, and error messages.

agent_id.description: The unique identifier of the agent for which the report is generated.

diff.description: The difference in the agent's state before and after the operation, useful for tracking changes.

after.description: The state of the agent after applying the operation, showing the result of the change.

before.description: The state of the agent before applying the operation, providing context for the change.

error_message.description: A detailed error message in case the operation failed for the agent, providing troubleshooting information.

AgentReport.title: AgentReport

BadRequest.description: This response indicates that the request was malformed or contained invalid parameters, and could not be processed.
BadRequest.title: BadRequest

CatalogResponse.description: Represents the response for a catalog listing, including a list of catalog checks and their details.

items.description: Corosync `token` timeout is set to the correct value

expectations.failure_message: Fencing is not configured for all nodes.
expectations.name: fencing_enabled

items.name: Corosync `token` timeout
items.remediation: The value of the Corosync `token` timeout is not set as recommended. Adjust the corosync `token` timeout as recommended...

items.description: A list of catalog checks included in the response, each with metadata and configuration options.

CatalogResponse.title: CatalogResponse

Check.description: Represents a single check from the catalog, including its metadata, configuration, and validation logic.

example.description: Corosync `token` timeout is set to the correct value

expectations.failure_message: Fencing is not configured for all nodes.
expectations.name: fencing_enabled

example.name: Corosync `token` timeout
example.remediation: The value of the Corosync `token` timeout is not set as recommended. Adjust the corosync `token` timeout as recommended...

description.description: A description of the check, outlining its purpose and expected behavior.

expression.description: The expression to be evaluated to get the expectation result for the check.

failure_message.description: A message returned when the check fails, providing context for troubleshooting.

name.description: The name of the expectation for the check.

type.description: The type of expectation for the check, such as expect or expect_same.

argument.description: The argument provided to the gatherer for fact collection.

gatherer.description: The gatherer used to collect the fact for the check.

name.description: The name of the fact gathered for the check.

group.description: The group to which the check belongs, providing logical organization.

id.description: The unique identifier of the check in the catalog.

metadata.description: Metadata associated with the check, providing additional context and categorization.

name.description: The name of the check in the catalog, used for identification and reporting.

remediation.description: A remediation message for the check, providing guidance on resolving issues detected.

severity.description: The severity of the check, such as critical or warning, indicating its impact.

expression.description: The expression to be evaluated to use the current value for the check.

value.description: The value to be used for this condition in the check.

default.description: The default value used if none of the conditions matches for the check.

name.description: The name of the value used in the check.

when.description: An expression to determine whether a check should run, allowing for conditional execution.

Check.title: Check

CheckResult.description: Represents the result of a check execution, including expectation evaluations and customization status.

expectation_results.failure_message: Fencing is not configured for all nodes.
expectation_results.name: fencing_enabled

agents_check_results.description: The aggregated result of the check execution, summarizing the overall outcome for the check.

check_id.description: The unique identifier of the check for which the result is reported.

customized.description: Indicates whether the check has been customized for this execution, allowing for tailored validation.

expectation_results.description: List of results for each expectation evaluated during the check, providing detailed outcome information.

example.failure_message: Fencing is not configured for all nodes.
example.name: fencing_enabled

result.description: Aggregated result of the check execution. Possible values are: passing, warning, or critical.

CheckResult.title: CheckResult

CustomValue.description: Represents a single custom value to be applied or already applied to a check, including its name and overriding value.

name.description: The name of the specific value to be customized for the check.

value.description: The overriding value to be applied to the check, replacing the default or previous value for customization purposes.

CustomValue.title: CustomValue

CustomizationRequest.description: Represents a request to customize a check, including the list of values to be customized for tailored validation.

values.description: A list of values to be customized for the check, allowing for flexible and targeted configuration.

CustomizationRequest.title: CustomizationRequest

CustomizationResponse.description: Represents the response for a customization operation, including the list of custom values applied to a check.

values.description: A list of custom values that have been applied to the check, reflecting the customization performed.

CustomizationResponse.title: CustomizationResponse

CustomizedCheckValue.description: Represents a single customized check value, including its name, custom value, default value, and customization status.

custom_value.description: The custom value that overrides the default value for this check, allowing for tailored validation.

customizable.description: Indicates whether the check value can be customized for execution, allowing for tailored validation.

default_value.description: The original value as defined by specification, resolved based on the environment.

name.description: The name of the customized check value.

CustomizedCheckValue.title: CustomizedCheckValue

ExecutionEnv.description: Defines the contextual environment settings used during the current execution, allowing for flexible configuration.
ExecutionEnv.title: ExecutionEnv

ExecutionResponse.description: Represents the details of an execution, including its status, timing, results, and associated targets. Can be running or completed.

expectation_results.failure_message: Fencing is not configured for all nodes.
expectation_results.name: fencing_enabled

check_results.description: The list of check results for this execution, providing detailed outcome information for each check.

completed_at.description: The timestamp indicating when the execution was completed, if applicable.

critical_count.description: The number of checks that resulted in a critical outcome during the execution.

execution_id.description: The unique identifier of the execution.

group_id.description: The unique identifier of the group associated with the execution.

passing_count.description: The number of checks that passed successfully during the execution.

result.description: The aggregated result of the execution, summarizing the overall outcome. Unknown for running executions.

started_at.description: The timestamp indicating when the execution started.

status.description: The current status of the execution, indicating its progress or completion state.

targets.description: The list of targets involved in the execution.

timeout.description: A list of agents that timed out during the execution process.

items.description: The unique identifier of the agent that timed out during the execution.

warning_count.description: The number of checks that resulted in a warning outcome during the execution.

ExecutionResponse.title: ExecutionResponse

ExpectationEvaluation.description: Represents the result of evaluating an expectation, including its name, value, type, and any failure message.

example.failure_message: Fencing is not configured for all nodes.
example.name: fencing_enabled

failure_message.description: A message describing the failure, only available for scenarios where the expectation was not met.

name.description: The name of the expectation being evaluated.

return_value.description: The value returned from the expectation evaluation, indicating the outcome of the check.

type.description: The type of evaluation performed for the expectation, such as expect or expect_same.

ExpectationEvaluation.title: ExpectationEvaluation

ExpectationEvaluationError.description: Indicates that an error occurred during the evaluation of an expectation, providing details for troubleshooting.

message.description: A detailed message describing the error encountered during expectation evaluation.

name.description: The name of the expectation for which the error occurred.

type.description: The type of error encountered during expectation evaluation, such as validation or runtime error.

ExpectationEvaluationError.title: ExpectationEvaluationError

ExpectationResult.description: Represents the result of an expectation evaluation, including its name, result, type, and any failure message.

example.failure_message: Fencing is not configured for all nodes.
example.name: fencing_enabled

failure_message.description: A message describing the failure, only available for scenarios where the expectation was not met.

name.description: The name of the expectation being evaluated.

result.description: Indicates whether the expectation condition was met during evaluation.

type.description: The type of evaluation performed for the expectation, such as expect or expect_same.

ExpectationResult.title: ExpectationResult

Fact.description: Represents a fact gathered during execution, including its check association and observed value.

check_id.description: The unique identifier of the check that produced this fact during execution.

name.description: The name of the fact representing the observed property or metric gathered during execution.

value.description: The value of the fact as observed during execution, which may be a string, number, boolean, object, or an array of these types.

Fact.title: Fact

FactError.description: Indicates that a fact could not be gathered during execution, providing details for troubleshooting data collection issues.

check_id.description: The unique identifier of the check for which the fact could not be gathered.

message.description: A detailed message describing the error encountered during fact gathering.

name.description: The name of the fact that could not be gathered during execution.

type.description: The type of error encountered during fact gathering.

FactError.title: FactError

Forbidden.description: This response indicates that access to the requested resource or operation is forbidden due to insufficient permissions.

errors.detail: The requested operation could not be performed.
errors.title: Forbidden

example.detail: The requested operation could not be performed.
example.title: Forbidden

detail.example: The requested operation could not be performed.

Forbidden.title: Forbidden

ListExecutionsResponse.description: Represents a paginated list of executions, including the total count and individual execution items.

expectation_results.failure_message: Fencing is not configured for all nodes.
expectation_results.name: fencing_enabled

items.description: A list of execution items included in the paginated response, each representing an execution instance.

total_count.description: The total number of executions included in the paginated response.

ListExecutionsResponse.title: ListExecutionsResponse

ListOperationsResponse.description: Represents a paginated list of operations, including the total count and individual operation items.

total_count.description: The total number of operations included in the paginated response.

ListOperationsResponse.title: ListOperationsResponse

NotCustomizedCheckValue.description: Represents a check value that has not been customized, including its name, default value, and customization status.

customizable.description: Indicates whether the check value can be customized for execution, allowing for tailored validation.

default_value.description: The original value as defined by specification, resolved based on the environment. Absent if value is not customizable.

name.description: The name of the check value that has not been customized.

NotCustomizedCheckValue.title: NotCustomizedCheckValue

NotFound.description: This response indicates that the requested resource could not be found in the system.

errors.detail: The requested resource cannot be found.
errors.title: Not Found

example.detail: The requested resource cannot be found.
example.title: Not Found

detail.example: The requested resource cannot be found.

NotFound.title: NotFound

OperationResponse.description: Represents the details of an operation, including its status, timing, results, and associated targets. Can be running or completed.

agent_reports.description: A list of reports from agents involved in the operation, providing detailed outcome information.

completed_at.description: The timestamp indicating when the operation was completed, if applicable.

description.description: A description of the operation, outlining its purpose and expected behavior.

group_id.description: The unique identifier of the group associated with the operation.

name.description: The name of the operation being performed.

operation.description: The type of operation executed, specifying the action performed.

operation_id.description: The unique identifier of the operation.

result.description: The aggregated result of the operation, summarizing the overall outcome. Unknown for running operations.

started_at.description: The timestamp indicating when the operation started.

status.description: The current status of the operation, indicating its progress or completion state.

targets.description: The list of targets involved in the operation.

updated_at.description: The timestamp indicating when the operation was last updated.

OperationResponse.title: OperationResponse

OperationTarget.description: Represents the target where operations are executed, including agent identification and arguments for execution.

agent_id.description: The unique identifier of the agent where the operation is executed.

arguments.description: A map of arguments provided for the operation execution, allowing for flexible configuration.

OperationTarget.title: OperationTarget

SelectableChecksResponse.description: Represents the list of selectable checks for a given execution group and environment, including details for customization and selection.

items.description: A sample selectable check for demonstration purposes, showing customization and selection options.
items.name: Check 1

items.description: A list of selectable checks available for execution, each with customization options and metadata.
A check that can be selected and customized for execution, providing flexibility in validation and reporting.

customizable.description: Indicates whether the check can be customized for execution, allowing for tailored validation.

customized.description: Indicates whether the check has already been customized for execution, reflecting user modifications.

description.description: A description of the selectable check, outlining its purpose and expected behavior.

group.description: The group to which the selectable check belongs.

id.description: The unique identifier of the check available for selection.

name.description: The name of the check available for selection and customization.

SelectableChecksResponse.title: SelectableChecksResponse

StartExecutionRequest.description: Defines the context required to run a check execution, including execution and group identifiers, targets, and environment settings.

execution_id.description: The unique identifier for the execution instance.

group_id.description: The unique identifier for the group associated with the execution instance.

target_type.description: The type of target for the execution, specifying the nature of the execution environment.

targets.description: A list of target agents involved in the execution, each specified by their unique identifier.

StartExecutionRequest.title: StartExecutionRequest

StepReport.description: Represents a report for a single step in an operation, including step details and agent outcomes.

name.description: The name of the operation step being reported.

operator.description: The operator used in the operation step, specifying the comparison or action performed.

predicate.description: The predicate evaluated in the operation step, defining the condition for success.

timeout.description: The timeout value for the operation step, specifying the maximum allowed duration in seconds.

StepReport.title: StepReport

Target.description: Represents the target where execution facts are gathered, including agent and check associations.

agent_id.description: The unique identifier of the agent for which facts are gathered during execution.

items.description: The unique identifier of the check associated with the target agent for execution.

Target.title: Target

Value.description: Represents a value used in the expectations evaluation, including its name, check association, and customization status.

check_id.description: The unique identifier of the check associated with the value.

customized.description: Indicates whether the value has been customized for the expectations evaluation.

name.description: The name of the value used in the expectations evaluation.

value.description: The value used in the expectations evaluation, which may be a string, integer, boolean, or array.

Value.title: Value

authorization.description: This security scheme uses Bearer token authentication for API access. Please provide a valid token in the Authorization header.

info.description: Wanda is an open source platform for automated cluster checks, health monitoring, and remediation. It provides APIs for managing checks, executions, customizations, and integrations with the Trento Platform. Wanda helps ensure high availability and reliability for your infrastructure by automating best practices and compliance checks.
info.title: Wanda

post.description: Start a Checks Execution on the target infrastructure
